So said  vrntech  on  2002-10-01 

>Hello Mr Rainsberger,
>
>Thanks for your suggestion.
>
>> >
>> >     I am starting to use JUnit and am relatively new to it. After 
>> >searching thru documentation, this news group and other sources, 
>some 
>> >issues still remain that I hope some of you can help answer.
>> >
>> >    1. We have a need to put some trace messages in the tests so 
>as 
>> >to know the progress of the test itself because each test can be 
>> >fairly timeconsuming. Is there a way to have these capture this 
>> >output for an individual test in the GUI-based TestRunner? I see 
>only 
>> >thing that is captured for each test on the UI are the assertion 
>> >failures. 
>> 
>> My guess is that if TestListener doesn't have something to allow 
>you to
>> log progress messages, then you can easily add something to it.
>
>I like your suggestion of adding to the TestListener. I am interested 
>in implementing this. But for this would I have to touch the JUnit 
>TestRunner source or do you think I can do it externally?

I believe that you will have to write your own TestRunner. You can use
existing TestRunners as a starting point for this work. I do not think
it will be particularly difficult.
